job_tasks.phrase: Build and maintain new ETL solutions and calculation engines.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the core software development task of building and maintaining data processing pipelines and calculation logic, which are integral parts of software applications.

job_tasks.phrase: Implement a new architecture to deliver data to the Credit Risk Datawarehouse applications.
job_tasks.justification: This involves the integration of data delivery mechanisms into existing data warehousing applications, a classic software integration task.

job_tasks.phrase: Improving stability, performance, and reliability of the Credit Risk applications.
job_tasks.justification: Enhancing the non-functional aspects of software applications (stability, performance, reliability) is a core software engineering responsibility.

job_tasks.phrase: Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product.
job_tasks.justification: This describes the software engineering practice of product ownership and full lifecycle support, which falls under development and maintenance.

job_tasks.phrase: your software requires to be trustworthy and you are keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards.
job_tasks.justification: Focusing on software trustworthiness and applying security standards is a fundamental aspect of secure software development.

job_tasks.phrase: Build scalable deployment pipelines, to support Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.
job_tasks.justification: This directly refers to building CI/CD pipelines, which is a key component of MLOps/DevOps practices for software deployment.

job_tasks.phrase: Automate test and make it part of the design, code, build and release process.
job_tasks.justification: Automating testing within the software development lifecycle (design, code, build, release) is a core DevOps/MLOps practice.

job_tasks.phrase: Own your product and know how your product(s) are performing implementing the required Observability/Monitoring.
job_tasks.justification: Implementing observability and monitoring for product performance is a key MLOps/DevOps responsibility.

job_tasks.phrase: Optimization of the service stability and continuity.
job_tasks.justification: This task focuses on improving the operational stability and continuity of services, which is a software engineering responsibility related to maintenance and reliability.

job_tasks.phrase: Enhance the CI/CD maturity, move to a containerized environment, prepare for the move to the public cloud etc.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase explicitly mentions improving CI/CD maturity, containerization, and cloud migration, all of which are core MLOps/DevOps activities.

job_tasks.phrase: Help Credit Risk to make big steps to the future.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase indicates a strategic contribution to the business unit's future development, aligning technical work with business goals.

job_tasks.phrase: In short, we expect you to have or help us have a vision on how to provide our services in the future.
job_tasks.justification: This points to strategic thinking and contributing to the future vision of service delivery, which falls under business understanding and strategy.

job_tasks.phrase: We are looking for an communicative DEV Engineer
job_tasks.justification: The explicit mention of 'communicative' directly maps to the communication skill category.

job_tasks.phrase: We expect you to share and teach your knowledge to other team members as well.
job_tasks.justification: Sharing and teaching knowledge to team members is a clear indicator of communication and collaboration skills.

soft_skills.phrase: share and teach your knowledge to other team members as well.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses heavily on traditional software engineering tasks (ETL, architecture implementation, application stability, CI/CD, testing, monitoring) and mentions core software development technologies like Java and Oracle. There is no mention of Generative AI, LLMs, prompt engineering, RAG, or specific AI/ML model development tasks. The role is about building and maintaining credit risk applications, which are software systems, rather than developing or integrating AI models as a core feature. Therefore, it fits the 'Software Engineer' profile.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear about its focus on traditional software engineering practices and technologies. There are no mentions of AI/ML specific tasks or tools, making the classification straightforward and unambiguous.
